bug.author: emptyVoid
bug.description:

<denchmark-h:h5>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-code>cmake -D CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Release -D OPENCV_EXTRA_MODULES_PATH=~/opencv_contrib-3.2.0/modules -D BUILD_CUDA_STUBS=OFF -D BUILD_DOCS=OFF -D BUILD_EXAMPLES=OFF -D BUILD_PERF_TESTS=OFF -D BUILD_TBB=OFF -D BUILD_TESTS=OFF -D BUILD_opencv_python2=OFF -D BUILD_opencv_python3=OFF -D WITH_IPP=ON -D IPPROOT=$IPPROOT -D WITH_TBB=ON -D BUILD_SHARED_LIBS=ON -D CPACK_BINARY_DEB=ON ~/opencv-3.2.0
make package </denchmark-code>

comments.comment: UPDATE No issue with dynamic linking of IPP (i.e. with -D BUILD_WITH_DYNAMIC_IPP=ON).

I've been able to build latest OpenCV with IPP 2017.2.174: <denchmark-code>-- Other third-party libraries: -- Use Intel IPP: 2017.0.2 [2017.0.2] -- at: <path>/ipp-17.2.174 -- linked: static </denchmark-code>
Looks like the issue had been fixed.
